title: A St. Louis Paper Already Online:   The Roman Flagrum . . .
post: I really enjoyed this paper, the author filled in a gap in shroud research and managed to find an actual specimen from the first century that could inflict wounds very close to the ones we see on the shroud. Offcourse most whips were made from leather and thus cannot survive to our time. But her research shows that the wounds are consistent with first century tools of torture.
author: Mike M
